bibl.title: James McGarth and William Herbert v. King County. Initial Verdict
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.ab: United States of America Territory of Washington County of King
In the district court of the third Judicial District of Washington Territory holding terms at the city of Seattle in said King County
United States of America vs James McGarth and William Herbert
div1.p: The grand jurors of the Territory of Washington, good and lawful men from the body of the said third Judicial District of said Territory, and from the body of the counties King and Kitsah duly elected, enpaneled, sworn, and charged on the part of said Territory of Washington to inquire within the counties aforesaid of all offenses against the laws of said Washington Territory, and likewise duly elected, empanneled, sworn and charged, upon the part of said United States to inquire within the said Third Judicial District of offenses therein committed against the laws of said United States upon their oaths to do therein present: That at the County of King in the District and Territory aforesaid, and within the jurisdiction of this court on the seventeeth day of March A.D. 1880 the said James McGarth and the said William Herbert
